at the White House the day after Woodward and Bernstein's first story about Watergate in the Washington Post, Donald Rumsfeld asserts he defied his colleagues and demanded to get to the root of the problem, saying, If any jackass across the street[ at campaign headquarters] or here had anything to do with this, he should be hung up by his thumbs today. Donald Rumsfeld is dismissive in his attitude to Colin Powell and Rice, whose decisions he constantly criticizes. Even before 9/11, he says Colin Powell 's State Department continually opposed his recommendation to reduce the numbers of American military forces

of Evansville political science professor. If Mike Pence is to encounter any bumps at all, they could come early, as he shifts his focus from federal to state issues, Robert Dion said. In some cases, it can be an awkward transition, to go from being a lawmaker to an executive, and to go from the federal level to the state level. There's going to be that transition that might have a few hiccups to it, he said.`` But he's familiar with all the issues, he's an energetic campaigner, he's got solid conservative credentials, he knows how to raise money.''
